title: Enumerative geometry and modularity in two-modulus K3-fibered Calabi-Yau threefolds
abstract: arXiv:2408.02994v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Motivated in part by the modular properties of enumerative invariants of K3-fibered Calabi-Yau threefolds, we introduce a family of 39 Calabi-Yau mirror pairs $(X,Y)$ with $h_{1,1}(X)=h_{2,1}(Y)=2$, labelled by certain integer quadruples $(m,i,j,s)$ with $m\leq 11$. On the A-model side, $X$ arises as a complete intersection in a projective bundle over a Fano fourfold $V_m^{[i,j]}$, and admits a Tyurin degeneration into a pair of degree $m$ Fano threefolds $F_m^{[i]}\cup F_m^{[j]}$ intersecting on an anticanonical K3 divisor of degree $2m$. On the B-model side, $Y$ is fibered by $M_{m}$-polarized K3-surfaces of Picard rank 19, and determined by a branched covering of $\mathbb{P}^1$, consistent with the Doran-Harder-Thompson mirror conjecture. When $s=0$, $Y$ itself acquires a Tyurin degeneration, and correspondingly $X$ acquires a fibration by degree $2m$ K3 surfaces, such that the two K\"ahler moduli control the size of the K3-fiber and

Title: Enumerative geometry and modularity in two-modulus K3-fibered Calabi-Yau threefolds
Abstract: arXiv:2408.02994v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: Motivated in part by the modular properties of enumerative invariants of K3-fibered Calabi-Yau threefolds, we introduce a family of 39 Calabi-Yau mirror pairs $(X,Y)$ with $h_{1,1}(X)=h_{2,1}(Y)=2$, labelled by certain integer quadruples $(m,i,j,s)$ with $m\leq 11$. On the B-model side, $Y$ is fibered by $M_{m}$-polarized K3-surfaces of Picard rank 19, and determined by a branched covering of $\mathbb{P}^1$, consistent with the Doran-Harder-Thompson mirror conjecture. tldr: 该文章聚焦于双模数K3纤维化Calabi-Yau三曼的代数几何和模性质，并通过引入一种新的分类方法，揭示了39对包含有双模特性的Calabi-Yau镜像对，为深入理解该类空间的代数几何性质和模结构提供了新的路径。
